awd_titl_txt: REU Site: Berkeley SETI Research Center
awd_abstract_narration:
This project will support research experiences for undergraduate students at the Berkeley SETI Research Center at the University of California-Berkeley. The project will support eight students per year for a 10-week experience working with scientists on individual projects related to the search for extra-terrestrial intelligence. The students will be trained in many areas of research and will be prepared for a future career in the sciences. Many of these students will be recruited from area community colleges and other schools with limited research opportunities.

The project will train students in a variety of areas associated with SETI. In particular the students will be engaged in projects drawn from the areas of astronomy, astrophysics, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, and computer science. The students will be working with large data sets from a variety of observations. The students will maintain contact with their mentors after the summer, allowing them to gain valuable advice for furthering their careers in STEM.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The goal of the Berkeley SETI REU site is to engage undergraduate students in cutting edge research around the search for technosignatures. This field is rapidly growing and there is an urgent need to engage and train the workforce that will undertake the next generation of technosignature searches. We accomplished this goal by admitting 24 students who participated in a variety of research connected with the Berkeley SETI / Breakthrough Listen portfolio of telescopes and projects.

Students participated in an intensive week-long bootcamp at the beginning of each summer, where they learned from the world's experts in radio astronomy, SETI, machine learning, Python, research ethics, and many other topics. They spent the rest of the summer working on research that includes big data, machine learning, anomaly detection, citizen science, high performance computing, and a range of other skills and topics.

Students also participated in weekly enrichment lectures, tutorials from experts in the GNU Radio open-source software-defined radio infrastructure, and took part in field trips to the Lick Observatory and Hat Creek Radio Observatory. At HCRO they had the opportunity to perfom observations using the GNU Radio backend on the Allen Telescope Array.

Interns presented their work in an end-of-summer symposium in person and on Zoom to the SETI community, as well as presenting their work at conferences; almost half of the technosignature presentations at the January 2023 American Astronomical Society meeting were led by current or former Berkeley SETI interns. Five students have had first-author papers published in refereed journals (four in the Astronomical Journal and one in Nature Astronomy). Many of the students have also been co-authors on additional papers arising from their research.

Two thirds of the interns will be pursuing advanced degrees as of Fall 2023, including two working primarily on technosignature research. Four students have received NSF Graduate Research Fellowships. Research produced by the students has been featured in a variety of national and international media including The New York Times, The Economist, National Geograhpic, space.com, as well as in videos, blogs, and posts on our social media.

Reviews of the program for our external evaluator show that it is having a significant impact on intern skills and outcomes in a variety of areas. Sample comments from students include:

"Everyone involved in the Berkeley SETI REU was amazing. The trips and conferences gave me an experience I never thought I'd have as an undergrad."

"Technosignatures are now one of my main interests! SETI involves asking some of the biggest questionshumans can conceptualize, and learning a lot about various SETI research techniques has been veryinspiring."

"Awesome summer! I've heard about other summer REU programs from my friends. Berkeley SETI is absolutely the best one!"

"I think it was the best summer of my life."
